definition: to refuse a toast only to be forced to drink a forfeit/fig. to hesitate to do sth until forced to do even more
pinyin: jing4 jiu3 bu4 chi1 chi1 fa2 jiu3

sentences.english: The president will make a speech and propose a toast first, and then the dinner will start.
sentences.chinese: 校長先要致祝酒辭並向大家敬酒，然後就開始了。

sentences.english: The guests started to exchange toasts with each other.
People at a stable will usually “Gan Bei” when toasting each other.
sentences.chinese: 人們往往以“乾杯”的方式互相敬酒。

sentences.english: Let the whole room know why you’re giving your congratulations to someone else.
sentences.chinese: 同時一定要讓所有的人都知道爲什麼你要對某人敬酒。

sentences.english: Mazel tov to the bride and groom.
For a foreigner, the practice of surrounding toasts here can be embarrassing.
sentences.chinese: 在外國人看來，這裏轉圈敬酒的習俗頗令人尷尬。

sentences.english: The couple starts toasting to all the guests.
sentences.chinese: 新郎新娘開始向每位客人敬酒了。

sentences.english: Most Chinese people have the tradition of making toasts at banquets.
sentences.chinese: 中國的宴席中一般都有敬酒的習俗。

sentences.english: A toast has been proposed in your honor.
Pat, you do the honors and propose the toast.
sentences.chinese: 帕特，你來敬酒並致祝酒詞吧。

sentences.english: Laughing over a good movie, spooning in bed, toasting our glasses.
sentences.chinese: 看一場好電影時大笑，在牀上互餵食物，敬酒。

sentences.english: Allow the event host to make the first toast.
The client drinks a toast of schnapps.
sentences.chinese: 房屋主人端喝一杯酒敬酒。

sentences.english: Stem, the leadership face wreathed in smilesly carry wine cup to arrive next toast go to.
sentences.chinese: 幹罷，領導滿面春風地端着酒杯到下一桌敬酒去了。

sentences.english: In the evening party, we drink to our friends' success or health to show our love.
sentences.chinese: 在晚宴上，我們以敬酒方式祝對方的健康或者成功。

sentences.english: The chairman proposed a toast to the guests.

definition: to toast sb (with wine etc)/to drink a toast
to urge sb to drink alcohol
to force sb to drink alcohol
short speech given in proposing a toast
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to offer a cigarette (to a guest)
short speech given in proposing a toast
